name: Mirror Source Data
description: Module migrates the intersect of fields found in source and destination project

project-settings.name:
Instructions

This rather complex module copies data from a source project to a destination project in response to a logical condition. The destination project could be in another arm of the main project or an entirely different REDCap project.

A common use of this module is to take screening data in one project and migrate to an official study project after vetting for eligibility and/or consent.

You can set up multiple migrations from a single source project (such as having many sub-studies off of a source participant list)
List of Destination Projects to receive Mirrored Data

sub_settings.name:
SOURCE EVENT
If longitudinal, enter the event where source data resides.
All data must be in one event, including the triggering form

TRIGGER LOGIC
Only clone from SOURCE if this logical expression is true (leave blank to always clone)

TRIGGERING FORM
The logic above will only be evaluated when this form is saved. If left blank, logic is applied after all saves (less efficient)

SELECT DESTINATION PROJECT
You must have access to the project to select it below

DESTINATION EVENT NAME
If destination project is classical, leave blank, otherwise specify destination event where data will go. (e.g. event_1_arm_1)
Check this option you want to enforce DAG configuration
DAG Configuration
Check this option if DAGs names are the same between Source and Destination projects.
If DAGs names are different between source and destination projects please specify the DAGs name
Select Source DAG
Type Destination DAG

SELECT FIELD COPY OPTIONS
Fields in both the source project and the target project have to have the same fieldnames (and same choices if radio/dropdown/checkbox)

choices.name: Migrate a specified list of fieldnames

sub_settings.name:
INCLUDED FIELD LIST
List of fields to include - must be present in both projects.

DESTINATION FORM ONLY
Migrate only the fields on this form.

SOURCE FORM ONLY
Migrate only fields from this SOURCE form.

EXCLUDED FIELD LIST
Remove these fields from the list generated above so they are not copied to the destination project

DESTINATION RECORD NAMING OPTIONS
Select how to determine the destination project record id.

choices.name: 1. AUTO-INCREMENT DESTINATION ID
2. USE SAME ID as SOURCE
3. USE FIELD VALUE FROM SOURCE

sub_settings.name:
DESTINATION NEXT RECORD ID MODE
Check this if you want to get the incremental of last record id to be record id. Otherwise next id will be next available record.

1. AUTO-INCREMENT DESTINATION ID OPTION
Add PREFIX to new DESTINATION ID
You can use specific words (e.g. STAN-). Or you can append DAG name or ID (e.g. [DAG:NAME]-, [DAG:ID]-). Leave blank for no prefix

1. AUTO-INCREMENT DESTINATION ID OPTION
Pad the new DESTINATION ID
If specified, it will pad the numerical portion of the record ID to the specified number of digits. For example, a padding of '4' will result in an id:STAN-0004 with a prefix of STAN-

3. USE FIELD VALUE FROM SOURCE OPTION
Specify field in source project to use as destination record ID.
Use this option if you need to manually specify your destination record ID.
If this field has no value in the source record, there will be no migration.
If two records share the same value or Clobber existing data is used, you could overwrite the destination data

LOG DESTINATION RECORD ID IN SOURCE FIELD
If specified, the destination's ID will be saved in this source field

LOG SOURCE RECORD ID IN DESTINATION PROJECT
If specified, the source record's ID will be saved in this destination field

LOG SOURCE MIGRATION TIMESTAMP IN DESTINATION PROJECT
If specified, the source migration timestamp will be saved in this destination field

TRIGGER SAVE RECORD HOOK IN DESTINATION PROJECT
If yes, redcap_save_hook will be triggered on destination project after record save.

GENERATE A SURVEY ON DESTINATION FOR USER TO FILL
If specified, the destination project will generate new survey for the user to get redirect to.

DEFINE SURVEY INSTRUMENT IN DESTINATION PROJECT
If specified, If destination survey generator is checked EM will generate a survey from this instrument.

FIELD IN SOURCE TO STORE DESTINATION SURVEY URL
If destination survey generator is checked the new generated survey url will be saved in this field to user to get redirected to.

REDO/CLOBBER MIGRATION
If checked, migration will be repeated on each source save.

This can result in multiple records being created if New ID creation is set or existing data in the destination project to be overwritten if TARGET ID is reused.

MIGRATION TIMESTAMP FIELD
This required field in the source project stores the timestamp when migration was completed.
Migration only takes place when this field is empty unless Clobber existing data is checked.

MIGRATION NOTES
(optional) Upon completion of migration, notes will be logged in this source field.
